name: Ramada Plaza Karachi Airport

reviews.text: We used the hotel waiting for a domestic flight. The hotel had a rep waiting outside of security for us at 2:30 AM. Hotel is secure, rooms are clean with a friendly staff. It was a welcome relief after a long international flight.
reviews.title: Pleasant surprise
excellent
reviews.text: Security at a high level,more razor wire than stalag luft 7. Very easy check in with a drink offered imediately. A pleasant room,comfortable bed and good shower but unworkable bath tap. Restaurant with a seriously good buffet at 800R (bargain) If the management read this, please please remove the electronic keyboard player from the entrance of the restaurant to the far reaches of the car park and preferably facing in the other direction. Its a good solution the guy keeps his job and the guests retain their sanity.
courtesy bus to airport any time. 4 mins.
reviews.title: No Problems

reviews.text: Short stay at hotel very near to airport and fairly easy to get to down town subject to usual traffic caveats. More has been done to protect hotel with barriers etc and no private cars allowed to drive up to hotel. Although stand off distance from road is not that great. Has all usual facilities and staff are fine. There is a small executive lounge with limited breakfast choice but provides a few average bites in early evening. Better to eat breakfast in main restaurant where food is standard and not that great but acceptable. Rooms are standard and well kept with smallish bathrooms.
reviews.title: A rather pleasant surprise

reviews.text: Very comfortable stay. Room was much better than expected. Do bring along a travel kettle if you need hot water/drinks. The room does not have one. The staff there are very friendly and helpful. A good stay overall.
reviews.title: Fantastic stop over

reviews.text: If you have to be in Karachi and can avoid the drive downtown, the Ramada Plaza at the airport is a comfortable and quiet haven from the surrounding chaos. Although the outside of the property is unimpressive, the inside has been transformed into a modern and fairly reliable business hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean, and the housekeeping staff is attentive and helpful. The hotel restaurant offers a varied menu that includes a large buffet and an a la carte menu with Pakistani and Western cuisine. The restaurant personnel were friendly, helpful, and always available to respond to any request.
reviews.title: A Comfortable Haven in Karachi

reviews.text: There remain a variety of infrastructure issues, some of which should have been addressed and others that any hotelier in Karachi would find difficult to overcome. Water from the bathroom faucet is not potable and bottled water is recommended, even for brushing teeth. Electrical outlets were worn, which caused them to occasionally arc or stop working completely. Internet service was quite slow and unreliable, but also inexcusably expensive. My trip to the spa provided one of the worst massages ever experienced and was much too expensive.
reviews.title: So-so hotel

reviews.text: Notwithstanding the negatives mentioned above, the convenience and relative safety of lodging in the secure zone around the airport and the amenities of the Ramada make it a good choice in Karachi.
reviews.title: Ramada

reviews.text: Stayed here on business because of office budget cuts. Not bad for value but don't expect great food. The internet is expensive so unless ur an expat who couldn't care less, be prepared to pay upwards of 30 dollars for 24 hours of net.
reviews.title: An awful hotel

reviews.text: Rooms downgraded because of no in room tea and coffee service...no excuses for not having these as standard in pakistan.
reviews.title: If you want to be near the airport, or even not, its the best bet
